name: Seafood Alfredo with Mushrooms and Snow Peas
author: Wendy Dixon
summary: This seafood Alfredo is a wonderful creamy dish that is very flavorful and great for any dinner party.
ingredients: 6 cloves garlic, or more to taste, minced
½ cup uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
2 tablespoons seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil
Cook fettuccine at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes
Meanwhile, heat butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add garlic; saute until fragrant, about 1 minute
Add mushrooms; saute until tender, about 5 minutes
Add shrimp, scallops, calamari, seafood seasoning, and pepper flakes; saute for 1 minute
Stir in half-and-half and pea pods
Sprinkle in Parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoon at a time, stirring constantly, until all has been added
Mix in parsley and season with salt and pepper
Reduce heat slightly and cook, stirring frequently to keep from boiling, until sauce has reached desired thickness and seafood is fully cooked, 8 to 10 minutes
Add drained fettuccine and toss until thoroughly combined
